      Parameters:

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      The initialize function is called when the FXML file is loaded. It sets up the buttons and text fields to be used in this class.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - Specify the location of the fxml file
      resources - Load the resources for the application

    • updateHand

      public void updateHand()
      The updateHand function updates the hand of tiles displayed on the screen. It does this by iterating through all of the children in a container, and if they are buttons, it sets their text to be equal to that tile's letter.

    • handleTileButtonClick

      public void handleTileButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The handleTileButtonClick function is called when a tile button is clicked. It sets the selectedTile variable to the Tile object corresponding to the clicked button, and disables all buttons if blockingTiles is true. If blockingTiles is false, it enables all buttons.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event

    • handlePaneClick

      public void handlePaneClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      The handlePaneClick function is called when a pane on the boardGrid is clicked. It determines which pane was clicked and performs actions based on that information.
      Parameters:
      MouseEvent - event Get the source of the event

    • resetTilesButtonClick

      public void resetTilesButtonClick()
      The resetTilesButtonClick function is called when the user clicks on the reset tiles button. It removes all of the tiles that were placed during this turn from both the gameBoard and boardGrid, resets other variables to their original values, and enables all of the buttons in rackGrid.

    • isTilePlacedDuringTurn

      public boolean isTilePlacedDuringTurn(int row, int column)
      The isTilePlacedDuringTurn function checks if a tile has been placed during the turn.
      Parameters:
      row - Check if the row of the tile matches any of the rows stored in positions array public boolean istileplacedduringturn(int row, int column) {
      column - Check if the column is valid public boolean isvalidcolumn(int column) {
      Returns:
      A boolean value that is true if the tile was placed during the turn and false otherwise

    • TryPlaceWordButtonClick

      public void TryPlaceWordButtonClick()
      The TryPlaceWordButtonClick function is called when the user clicks on the "Try Place Word" button. It checks if all of the tiles that were placed during this turn are in a legal word, and if so, it adds them to the game board and passes turn to next player. If not, it resets all of those tiles back into their original positions.

    • resetPositionsArray

      public void resetPositionsArray()
      The resetPositionsArray function clears the positions array by setting all elements to null. It also resets the index of the positions array to 0.

    • enableButtons

      public void enableButtons()
      The enableButtons function is used to enable all the buttons in the tilesContainer. This function is called when a button has been clicked and it's time for another button to be clicked.

    • disableButtons

      public void disableButtons()
      The disableButtons function disables all the buttons in the tilesContainer except for the button that was clicked. This is done so that a user cannot click on multiple buttons at once, which would cause an error. The disableButtons function also sets blockingTiles to true, which prevents any other functions from being called while this function is running.

    • successPlaceWord

      public void successPlaceWord(Word word)
      The successPlaceWord function is called when the user successfully places a word on the board. It updates the tiles and hand, resets all helper variables for a new turn, and enables all buttons.
      Parameters:
      word - Get the tiles that were used to place a word public void updatehand() {

    • EndTurnButtonClick

      public void EndTurnButtonClick()
      The EndTurnButtonClick function is called when the player clicks on the End Turn button. It calls resetTilesButtonClick to make sure that all tiles are in their proper place, and then it passes turn control to the next player.

    • EndGameButtonClick

      public void EndGameButtonClick()
      The EndGameButtonClick function is called when the user clicks on the End Game button. It calls a function in the viewModel that ends the game and returns to main menu.

    • challengeButtonClick

      public void challengeButtonClick()
      The challengeButtonClick function is called when the challenge button is clicked. It calls the viewModel's challenge function, which will send a request to the server for a new game.

    • update

      public void update(Observable o, Object arg)
      The update function is called whenever the ViewModel notifies its observers. The update function checks what type of notification it received and updates the board accordingly.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - Determine which observable object called the update function
      arg - Pass the message from the observable to its observers
